reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Coming in hot, going out hot.
reviews.reviewText: Another gripping, action packed novel by the talented Dustin Stevens. Keep up the good work and entertaining stories. Looking forward to the next adventure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Not a fan of how this was written. I prefer books that are stories..... like being told a story. This book is like a condensed version of a story. If you were forced to take all the unnecessary words out of a story, you'd be left with a read like this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love Ham she is a woman after my own heart. More coming up and looking forward to reading them. This is really good writing th for writing this serues. Much luck with all your endeavors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This was an OK book. The story was decent but jumping between individual's first party narrative was irritating. If you were given the name of the person speaking/thinking at the beginning of a chapter, it would have helped. In the end you just kind of assume who's talking. I also disliked the authors use of 'that' vs 'who' when referring to an individual. Could have been better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 3 down, 2 to go!
reviews.reviewText: Can hardly wait to start “Home!” Binging isn’t just a word, it’s become my lifestyle with this series! Please hurry up with audio versions after “Ham” as I hooked my husband to audio while we exercise!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Too Much Inappropriate and Meaningless Killing
reviews.reviewText: Ham may accept the next job, but I sure won't be reading it. I guess in the next book everybody will still be "grunting softly" instead of speaking and replying. That got tiresome. I love the Dustin Stevens books, but this book is very disappointing. I have begun to dislike Ham intensely. The killing is ridiculous, for instance, when she arrives for a meeting with Manson, and an old antagonist gets out of the car and is somewhat polite, she jumps him and murders him on the spot with no compunction, and walks away to casually chat with Manson. That just isn't okay with me. Her forte seems to be killing people, and who knows what happens to their bodies. She is hyped up for the next kill. Personally, I enjoyed everything about the Reed and Billie books, which were far superior to the Ham books. I just can't waste my time reading this book. The first Ham book in this series was good, but the next two are not worthy of Dustin Stevens in my opinion. If this is what the books have come to, I don't know what to look for in his more recent books to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The drama of Ham continues with Rules. This Book #3 in the series from DustinStevens. Like Books #1 and #2 your are not disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Love the character and books 1 & 2. This book just has too many uneeded words that seem to just drag down the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 2, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Compulsive reading following the course of a case from the past which Hill wished he had ended with a bullet. Too late for him now he is in a wheelchair he calls in an old favour. Ham is recruited to sort the mess that results from Alves being paroled and pardoned to exact revenge on the witness and prosecutor who put him away for life. Ham takes it on herself to follow the case through and find who is responsible for the release and the reason behind it, politics and money. A good story but some of the word order seems as if it was written by Yoda.
An excellent story, plenty of action.
First in the series that I have read. A bit to much violence but that is the type of novel. Having said that the storyline was decent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: Minimal storyline bagged out by four times the amount of filler
reviews.reviewText: Like others have said, there is so much filler in this story that it could have been written in about a quarter of the words actually used. I found that the short stabby sentences that were used to describe the musings of the character /story/thread meant I could skip most of the text to get to the point - not a good sign. By way of example, the main character's phone rings and it takes nearly two pages of words before they actually answer the phone!The story itself is nothing new nor nothing special, the plot is a standard one and the main protagonist is so macho it's a wonder they don't fight themselves. I found a couple of typos or misspells depending on what was actually meant, but more importantly, I must remember this author's name as I won't be reading any more of their books if this is actually their style of writing.
I couldn't get past the first few chapters.
